New Records: Alek Thomas became the first player in MLB history with three or more hits and two or more stolen bases in a Game 7.
Key Match Events: Diamondbacks swept the Milwaukee Brewers in the Wild Card Series
Diamondbacks swept the Los Angeles Dodgers in the National League Division Series
Diamondbacks took two of three at home and, more remarkably, back-to-back games at Citizens Bank Park to send Zack Wheeler, Bryce Harper, Kyle Schwarber and a host of other Phillies star players home
Brandon Pfaadt struck out seven in four innings of work
Kevin Ginkel struck out 13 in nine innings of work in the playoffs
Paul Sewald retired Castellanos, Marsh and pinch hitter Jake Cave in order to send the Diamondbacks to the World Series
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Torey Lovullo stated that the team loves proving naysayers wrong
Chris 'Mad Dog' Russo publicly stated that he would retire if the Diamondbacks won Games 6 and 7 in Philadelphia
Post-Match Reflections: Evan Longoria said that the team consistently defied the expectations set for them
Torey Lovullo stated that the team's character and belief grew more with every test they passed
Corbin Carroll said that going to the World Series feels 'pretty fâ€”ing good.. That's what you dream about'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Diamondbacks are going to the World Series for the first time since 2001
The game dates for this year's World Series are precisely the same as they were in 2001
The Diamondbacks are the first team to ever go from a 110 or more loss season to a World Series berth in the span of two years
